com.milk.uberchat.iface
Interface ChatSystem

All Superinterfaces:
ChatEntity, Commandable, Editable
All Known Implementing Classes:
BaseSystem
public interface ChatSystem
extends ChatEntity, Editable

This interface is what all chat systems must adhere to. It allows for clients to request stuff like connecting, disconnecting, and arranging to receive messages transmitted from the host.

This interface is defined to extend Editable as both the way for users to tweak the parameters of a system, and in order to facilitate saving and loading.

Author:
Dan Bornstein, danfuzz@milk.com
, Copyright 1998-1999 Dan Bornstein, all rights reserved.

Method Detail

addListener

public void addListener(java.util.EventListener listener)

Add a listener for this system. If the listener is in fact a SystemListener, then it immediately gets sent a connect-type event if the system is anything but disconnected, and it gets sent an identityAdded event for all pre-existing identities. Note that ChatIdentitys only come into existence when a connection is successfully made to a host system.

Specified by:
addListener in interface ChatEntity
Parameters:
listener - the listener to add
See Also:
SystemEvent, SystemListener

canonicalUserName

public java.lang.String canonicalUserName(java.lang.String orig)
Turn the given user name into its canonical form. For example, if case is ignored for this system, this might return it as all lower-case. The returned string should also be interned.

Parameters:
orig - the original name
Returns:
the canonical form

canonicalChannelName

public java.lang.String canonicalChannelName(java.lang.String orig)
Turn the given channel name into its canonical form. For example, if case is ignored for this system, this might return it as all lower-case. The returned string should also be interned.

Parameters:
orig - the original name
Returns:
the canonical form

connect

public void connect()
(Attempt to) connect to this system. A systemConnecting event will be sent if a connection actually get attempted, and a systemConnected event gets sent once a connection actually is successful. If the connection is unsuccessful, then a systemDisconnected event gets sent.

disconnect

public void disconnect()
Disconnect from this system. A systemDisconnecting event will be sent immediately if it is valid to disconnect from the system (i.e., the system is in fact connected). Once the system is actually disconnected, a systemDisconnected event gets sent.

getConnectionState

public int getConnectionState()
Return the current state of the connection of this system to its host. It is one of the constants ChatSystem.CONNECTING, ChatSystem.CONNECTED ChatSystem.DISCONNECTING, or ChatSystem.DISCONNECTED.

Returns:
the current state of the connection

getIdentities

public ChatIdentity[] getIdentities()
Get the list of ChatIdentitys for this system. Note that if the system is not connected, this should return an empty array.

Returns:
non-null; the list (array actually) of identities

getTemplate

public ChatSystemTemplate getTemplate()
Get a template which is suitable for handing to a factory to recreate a ChatSystem like this one. It is valid for a system to not have an associated factory, but that will make it impossible to reasonably edit the system. In that case, this method returns null.

Returns:
null-ok; a suitable template, if any
